newsitem.title: ESTONIA: ERA PANK SATISFIED WITH MARKET POSITION.
newsitem.headline: ERA PANK SATISFIED WITH MARKET POSITION.

text.p: Era Pank, the Tartu-based bank which is Estonia's seventh largest in terms of balance sheet volume, is satisfied with its position on the market and hopes to increase customer service.
Era Pank chairman Andres Bergmann also said that the bank was active in Ukrainian markets.
"We aim to provide a very good client service and to provide a service to those clients with good links between East and West," he told Reuters in an interview.
The bank currently has just three branches, one in Tartu, one in Tallinn and in Parnu but Bergmann said he did not consider the bank as a niche operation.
"We do not see the bank having lots of branches but within our branch building we try to provide complete banking and financial services," he said.
"At present we are the seventh largest bank by balance sheet volume and we are active in foreign exchange trading," he said.
"Our foreign exchange dealing in Ukraine is one of the highest of the Estonian banks," he added.
Bergmann's is one of the few banks which does not have a stock market listing and he said he was happy with the way things were.
"If you go to the share market then it is a question of what you are in it for. We are now equipped with enough own capital to support our balance volume, he added.
"If more is needed then we will consider going to the market," Bergmann said.
Treasury department head Vivika Tael said the bank's aim was to boost its service levels.
"The key for development in the next year is providing medium-sized clients with a client-oriented service," she said.
